title: 114_hr5879
content: MODIFICATIONS OF CREDIT FOR PRODUCTION FROM ADVANCED NUCLEAR POWER FACILITIES. The amendment to Section 45J(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes the allocation of unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation by the Secretary after December 31, 2020. After December 31, 2020, the unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation will be allocated by the Secretary to facilities based on their placement in service dates. The term 'unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation' refers to the excess of 6,000 megawatts over the total national megawatt capacity limitation allocated by the Secretary before January 1, 2021, minus any allocation to facilities not in service by that date. The term 'unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation' refers to the excess of 6,000 megawatts over the total national megawatt capacity limitation allocated by the Secretary before January 1, 2021, minus any allocation to facilities not in service before such date. Coordination with other provisions is ensured for any unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation allocated by the Secretary, treating it in the same manner as an allocation of national megawatt capacity limitation. Subsection (d)(1)(B) does not apply to any facility receiving such allocation. The subsection (d)(1)(B) does not apply to facilities receiving the allocation. If a qualified public entity elects to apply a credit for a taxable year, the eligible project partner specified in the election will be treated as the taxpayer for that credit. Definitions for this subsection are provided. The term 'qualified public entity' refers to a government entity, mutual electric company, or not-for-profit electric utility for the purpose of applying a tax credit. The term 'eligible project partner' refers to any person involved in designing or constructing an advanced nuclear power facility eligible for a tax credit. The tax credit under subsection (a) applies to those involved in providing the nuclear steam supply system and nuclear fuel to the advanced nuclear power facility. The tax credit under subsection (a) applies to individuals involved in the advanced nuclear power facility, including those with ownership interests. Special rules apply for partnerships. The tax credit applies to individuals involved in the advanced nuclear power facility, including those with ownership interests. Partnerships have special rules, where a qualified public entity is treated as the taxpayer for the entity's distributive share of the credit. The term 'eligible project partner' includes any partner of the partnership. The credit is taken into account in the first taxable year of the eligible project partner. The tax credit applies to individuals involved in the advanced nuclear power facility, including those with ownership interests. Partnerships have special rules, where a qualified public entity is treated as the taxpayer for the entity's distributive share of the credit. The term 'eligible project partner' includes any partner of the partnership. The credit is taken into account in the first taxable year of the eligible project partner, ending with or after the qualified public entity's taxable year. Any benefit derived by an eligible project partner in connection with an election under this subsection shall not be considered as a private business use. The tax credit applies to individuals involved in advanced nuclear power facilities, including those with ownership interests. Partnerships have special rules, where income received in connection with an election under section 45J(e)(1) is treated as meeting losses and expenses for mutual or cooperative electric companies. The tax credit applies to individuals involved in advanced nuclear power facilities, including those with ownership interests. Partnerships have special rules for income received in connection with an election under section 45J(e)(1) to meet losses and expenses for mutual or cooperative electric companies. Effective dates for amendments are specified: unutilized limitation amounts take effect upon enactment of the Act, while transfer of credit by certain public entities applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2016.
